# cURL Command Template
# Generated by Universal API Tester
# Date: {timestamp}

# Basic cURL command structure:
# curl [options] [URL]

# Common options:
# -X, --request METHOD    HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)
# -H, --header HEADER     Add header to request
# -d, --data DATA         HTTP POST data
# -F, --form NAME=CONTENT Form data
# -b, --cookie COOKIE     Send cookies
# -c, --cookie-jar FILE   Write cookies to file
# -u, --user USER:PASS    Server user and password
# -A, --user-agent AGENT  Send User-Agent string
# -e, --referer URL       Referer URL
# -L, --location          Follow redirects
# -k, --insecure          Allow insecure connections
# -v, --verbose           Verbose output
# -s, --silent            Silent mode
# -o, --output FILE       Write output to file
# -O, --remote-name       Write output to file named as remote file

# Example cURL commands:

# GET request with headers
curl -X GET \
  -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  "https://api.example.com/data"

# POST request with JSON data
curl -X POST \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -d '{"key": "value", "number": 123}' \
  "https://api.example.com/create"

# POST request with form data
curl -X POST \
  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
  -d "username=admin&password=secret" \
  "https://api.example.com/login"

# File upload
curl -X POST \
  -F "file=@/path/to/file.jpg" \
  -F "description=My file" \
  "https://api.example.com/upload"

# With cookies
curl -X GET \
  -b "session=abc123; user=john" \
  "https://api.example.com/protected"

# Save cookies to file and use them
curl -c cookies.txt -X POST \
  -d "username=admin&password=secret" \
  "https://api.example.com/login"

curl -b cookies.txt -X GET \
  "https://api.example.com/dashboard"

# Basic authentication
curl -u username:password \
  "https://api.example.com/protected"

# Follow redirects
curl -L "https://example.com"

# Save output to file
curl -o output.json "https://api.example.com/data"

# Verbose output for debugging
curl -v -X GET "https://api.example.com/data"
